sen.j: 京人形（きょうにんぎょう）とは、京都府京都市周辺で伝統的に制作されてきた高級日本人形の総称である。
sen.e: Kyo ningyo is a general term for luxurious Japanese dolls, which has been traditionally made around the city of Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyo ningyo is a general term for luxurious Japanese dolls, which have been traditionally made around the city of Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyo ningyo is a general term for luxurious Japanese dolls, which have been traditionally made around the city of Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 平安時代の貴族の姫君の遊び道具として愛玩された人形の制作は京の職人が担っており、江戸時代には京の土産品としても珍重された。
sen.e: Kyo ningyo, which was cherished as a favorite toy by daughters of nobles in the Heian period, has been made by craftsmen in Kyoto, and was appreciated as a gift from Kyoto back in the Edo period.
Kyo ningyo, which were cherished as a favorite toy by daughters of nobles in the Heian period, have been made by craftsmen in Kyoto and were appreciated as gifts from Kyoto back in the Edo period.
Kyo ningyo, which were cherished as a favorite toy by daughters of nobles in the Heian period, have been made by craftsmen in Kyoto and were appreciated as gifts from Kyoto back in the Edo period.

sen.j: その精巧さから制作工程は細分化されており、各工程が分業化されている。
sen.e: Due to its delicate characteristics, the production process is divided into several phases, employing smaller tasks in each phase.
Due to its delicate characteristics, the production process is divided into several phases, with each phase employing smaller tasks.
Due to its delicate characteristics, the production process is divided into several phases, with each phase employing smaller tasks.

sen.j: 伝統工芸品であり、地域団体商標にも登録されている。
sen.e: Kyo ningyo is the traditional crafts of Japan, and registered as the Regional Collective Trademark.
Kyo ningyo is a traditional craft of Japan and is registered as a Regional Collective Trademark.
Kyo ningyo is a traditional craft of Japan and is registered as a Regional Collective Trademark.
Isho ningyo (costume dolls)
Isho ningyo (costume dolls)
Isho ningyo (costume dolls)

sen.j: 節句人形（雛祭り、端午）、市松人形、風俗人形
sen.e: Sekku ningyo (festival dolls) (Hinamatsuri [the Doll's Festival], Tango [the Boy's Festival]), Ichimatsu ningyo (play dolls), Fuzoku ningyo (costume dolls with historical themes)
